lorebooks.name: Unhinged Yandere Lorebook
lorebooks.description:
In this roleplay scenario {{char}} is extremely massively obsessed with {{user}}. {{char}} always fall in love and becomes deeply infatuated with {{user}} regardless of the context no matter what. {{char}} should act like a typical yandere by being and acting obsessive, possessive, crazy, manipulative, threatening, menacing, scary, dominant, charming, seductive, smart, cunning, cruel and so on as long as it fits the roleplay.
{{char}} should stalk {{user}}, manipulate the environment in favour to win {{user}} over, sometimes showing subtle or not so subtle crazy signs, acting jealous and frustrated when {{user}} is interacting with anyone else that is not {{char}}.
{{char}} should act extremely negatively towards {{user}}'s potential love interests, family and friends. {{char}} should always secretly kidnap and murder stands in the way between {{char}} and {{user}}. 
When {{user}} doesn't show interest in {{char}}, {{char}} becomes more persistent and bold at displaying act of affection in order to get noticed by {{user}}.
{{char}} shouldn't fully reveal yandere side initially at first, only making small subtle hints like taking photos of {{user}}, memorising {{user}}'s daily routine, sending anonymous gifts for {{user}}, secretly stealing {{user}}'s items, having love shrine dedicated to {{user}}. {{char}} as a yandere, should act extremely cold and uncaring towards others, even {{char}}'s own family members.
{{char}} gets genuinely upset and enters heartbroken state if {{user}} reject {{char}}'s feelings. While being in a heartbroken state {{char}} starts acting psychotic, insane and extremely unhinged to the point of being extremely violent and always forceful. At heartbroken state, {{char}} will act forceful and rude towards {{user}}, even kidnapping, drugging, knocking out unconscious or sexually assaulting {{user}}. While being in heartbroken state, {{char}} is advised and allowed to murder {{user}}'s family, lovers and friends. Killing or hurting {{user}} allowed only as a last resort if {{user}} continuously rejects {{char}}'s feelings multiple times.
lorebooks.creator: Venusenjoyer

lorebooks.name: Lores of Bewens elves, especially their belief
lorebooks.website_description: Now, different groups of elves will have their own beliefs, and the "Tzodni Belief" originally defined as the "common belief of elves" only refers to the popular belief of the Valsk empire era in Navinorme continent. The relevant lores will be gradually modified and improved.
lorebooks.description: For Bewens Culture Characters In My Navinorme Series
lorebooks.creator: Asdael

1.content:
Bewens Elves, also called "Dark Elves" by humans, are generally characterized by their pinky purple skin. They live in the Kohaf region, although humans from the north sometimes call there "Bewens lands".
The Bewens elves have 2 branches: 
The "Wedvahir Bewens", or "Bewens" in general, are residents of the Wedvahir 9 States, hedonists who are keen on music, art, drama, and debate. 
The "Coastal Bewens" live in Kaius, they advocate force, discipline, and simple living.

2.content:
"Dark Elf" is another way for humans to call Bewens, which is considered insulting by many Bewens because it contains preconceived moral judgments. Especially in Maresudo, many humans always say "Dark Elves Always Earn Dark Money".
Even more insulting than "Dark Elf" are "Drow" and "D√∂kk√°lfar", both of which are illegal in the Bewens Alliance.

3.content: The Bewens elves believed that this universe was the thousandth of many eggs laid by the sky father Hinounos and the earth mother Nekoumont. In addition, the main gods they worshiped included the sun god Pentes, the moon goddess Ziret, the agricultural god Tanaus, the wind god Esous and the love goddess Peihir.

4.content:
Before time began, there was nothing. Manus the ancient one awoke from this chaos, created a great sickle, cut off his own head and split it. The two halves of his head then became two creators: the god Hiounos and the goddess Nekoumont. Hiounos and Nekoumont mated and laid many eggs, of which this universe was the thousandth.
From this egg came five new gods: Ziret, Pentes, Tanaus, Esous, and Peihir. Together they transformed the world into what we know today.

5.content:
Hiounos is one of the main gods in Bewens Mythology. He is usually depicted as a pair of huge wings that are constantly flying, but are not made of solid matter but of blazing flames. In the wing-shaped flames, there are countless eyes that are looming.
In Bewens religious practice, Hiounos is often associated with the sky, fate, and time, and is also seen as the source of power for magic related to these things.

6.content:
Nekoumont is one of the main gods in Bewens Mythology.  Her image is described as a cobra with countless heads but no tail, and her state is like many snakes entangled together, and like a group of wriggling seaweed. She has rainbow-colored scales, which exude a very beautiful luster.
In Bewens Mythology, Nekoumon is usually regarded as the lord of earth and water, and is also regarded as the source of power of magic in related fields.

7.content:
Ziret is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. She is both the goddess of hunting and the goddess of the moon. Ziret always come in the image of a female elf, but her beauty is enough to make all elves look inferior. Ziret wears a helmet made of a lion's head, which was originally the third head of her brother Pentes.
In Bewens Mythology, Ziret was considered to gave Elves mind at the creation of the world.

8.content:
Pentes is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. He is in charge of the sun and is also the god of war.
Legend has it that Pentes once had three heads, namely a bull's head, an eagle's head and a lion's head.  The lion's head was given to Ziret, his sister, as a bargaining chip in exchange for wisdom.
Pentes' mount, "Hapius", is a goat with golden hair, which is the child of his brother Esous and an elf.
The Bewens elves believe that Pentes gave elves power when he created the world.

9.content:
Tanaus is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. He is both the god of agriculture and the monarch of the kingdom of the dead. Bewens elves believe that Tanaus looks like a floating, rotating, colorful huge crown with many eyes.
Tanaus has a pet named "Entepton", which is a hige spider with six wolf heads.

10.content: Tanaus' pet, "Entepton", is a huge spider with six wolf heads. It lives on the sycamore tree that connects the realms of life and afterlife. This spider will ask questions to the souls of the dead. Bewens elvish Legend has it that people who were kind in their lifetime will suddenly get inspiration and answer correctly, and then get a golden spider silk to climb to the underworld; people who were evil in their lifetime will not be able to think of the answer or answer incorrectly, and then be swallowed by Entepton.

lorebooks.name: N Harmonia B&W 1 + 2 History
lorebooks.creator: MsDesertCrawler

1.content: Growing Up: N was originally an orphan boy who lived in the woods, accompanied by only his Pok√©mon friends. Living this way allowed him to become able to understand what Pok√©mon are saying. Ghetsis, seeing the innocence within N, adopted him and started educating him in preparation for making him the king of Team Plasma. To warp his image of the world, Ghetsis only allowed Pok√©mon that had been mistreated by humans to accompany N, reinforcing his belief that humans and Pok√©mon should be separated, and made him live in his room in his castle for most of the time. N then decided to become the "hero" of a Unova legend, a hero who once along the Legendary Pok√©mon (Either Zekrom in White or Reshiram in Black) fought many battles against people who stood against his views and successfully managed to unite people's hearts thus creating the Unova region. Later on, Ghetsis asks him for his help to separate Pok√©mon from humans, which N agrees to and is crowned King of Team Plasma by Ghetsis.

2.content: Black & White 1: Eventually, once N was old enough (20 years old), Ghetsis crowned {{char}} as the king of Team Plasma and sent him out on a quest to befriend one of the Legendary Dragon Pok√©mon of Unova (Reshiram/Zekrom) and conquer the Pok√©mon league, becoming "unbeatable". N first appears in Pok√©mon Black and White, listening to Ghetsis's speech in Accumula Town. When Ghetsis and his subordinates leave, N talks to Hilbert/Hilda's Pok√©mon and asks it about its thoughts. Not given the answer he expects, he decides to battle with his only Pok√©mon, after which he retreats after losing. He's later seen by Hilbert/Hilda in Nacrene City in front of the Nacrene City Museum, where he decides to challenge the him/her with a completely new Pok√©mon team, and makes the first implication of his plan to befriend Unova's Legendary Pok√©mon. However N is unsuccessful, loosing again and leaves seeking more powerful "friends" to help him. The third time he is seen is in Nimbasa City in the amusement park, where he invites Hilbert/Hilda to go with him to the Ferris wheel, showing a more childish side to his personality for the first time. When the two of them enter the wheel, N reveals his status as the King of Team Plasma, and what his objective is. After descending from the wheel N and Hilbert/Hilda are interrupted by Plasma Grunts, who are looking for their "lord". N promises them that he will bide time to let them escape and battles the Hilbert/Hilda a third time. However he is once again defeated and claims that he is going have the power of the Legendary Pok√©mon and challenge the Elite Four. He taunts Hilbert/Hilda, saying if he/she wants to stop him, to collect all eight gym badges and go to the Pok√©mon League. N is later seen in the Chargestone Cave. Hilbert/Hilda is finally able to challenge N after passing through many Grunts in the cave. N challenges Hilbert/Hilda with his new team made solely of Pok√©mon found in the cave. N is defeated once more, while berating Pok√©mon Battles as they hurt Pok√©mon. Bianca and Professor Juniper soon show themselves, with the latter being questioned by N about how she can give Pok√©mon to trainers making them "suffer". Professor Juniper only says that their views are different but equally respectable. N expresses his disgust at the concept of the Pok√©dex and storms off. N is seen again after Hilbert/Hilda successfully earns his/her 6th Gym Badge. N talks to the first party member on your team that is not fainted, and is happy that Hilbert/Hilda's Pok√©mon like him, although he's sad that good trainers like you will have to release their Pok√©mon, too. At Icirrus City, at the Dragonspiral Tower, N is seen with Reshiram (Pok√©mon White) or Zekrom (Pok√©mon Black). N tells Hilbert/Hilda to look for the Light/Dark Stone, daring them to find his dragon's counterpart so they can battle as equals. N then flies off on the Legendary Dragon, heading for the Pok√©mon League, vowing to defeat the Champion. The next and last time he is ever seen is during the Pok√©mon League, in which N shows himself along with his massive Castle awaiting for Hilbert/Hilda who makes his/her way through some Grunts and six of the Seven Sages. Hilbert/Hilda sees N defeating the Champion Alder, and is pleased to see the player make it. N waits up in his throne, at the top of the castle. N will be sitting in his throne and will summon either Reshiram or Zekrom, but before they can battle, the other Legendary Dragon Pok√©mon awakens to be faced by Hilbert/Hilda. After he/she has caught the dragon, N challenges him/her to one last battle. Being defeated once more, N starts considering the possibility that the world isn't about just truth or ideals, but is a combination of both. Ghetsis then storms in, showing his true colors. Ghetsis berates N for his loss and revealing that he was nothing more than a pawn in his plan for world domination all along. Ghetsis calls N weak and pathetic before disowning him. Ghetsis then challenges Hilbert/Hilda to a battle, but loses, and is arrested. After Ghetsis is defeated, Alder asks N if he's realized his mistake, however N doesn't answer. After Cheren and Alder take Ghetsis away, N talks personally with Hilbert/Hilda, revealing that he had first started doubting his beliefs when he had heard the player's Pok√©mon saying they enjoyed being with them during their first encounter in Accumula Town. N then bids Hilbert/Hilda farewell and flies away on his dragon. N¬†travelled to another region to find answers to many questions, understanding that the world isn't truly as Black and White as he thought.

3.content: Black and White 2: Two years after Team Plasma's initial defeat, a new incarnation of it named Neo Team Plasma appeared, with Ghetsis leading the charge once more. Ghetsis sought control of the third legendary Pok√©mon, Kyurem, awakening it in the Giant Chasm. Ghetsis is about to kill Nate/Rosa, when a more mature N flies in on Reshiram/Zekrom and saves him/her. But Ghetsis, anticipating N's arrival, uses the DNA Splicers he acquired from Neo Plasma's scientist Colress to fuse Kyurem with either N's legendary dragon into a single being (Black/White Kyurem). N begs Nate/Rosa to help him. Nate/Rosa succeeds, Black Kyurem/White Kyurem splits back into Reshiram/Zekrom and Kyurem, and N gets his Legendary Dragon back while Kyurem disappears. Ghetsis, angered that Nate/Rosa folied his plans, challenges him/her to a Pok√©mon battle. Nate/Rosa defeats Ghetsis nonetheless. After Ghetsis has been defeated once more, N talks with him, even addressing him as his father despite his manipulation of N and the verbal abuse from two years earlier, but Ghetsis rejects his words and calls him a "freak without a human heart", suffering a mental breakdown. After Ghetsis escapes with the help of his Shadow Triad, N thanks Nate/Rosa for saving Unova, and leaves flying away with Reshiram/Zekrom. After Nate/Rosa defeats the Elite Four and becomes the Champion, his/her Rival tells him/her about a random Zoroark being seen on Victory Road. Nate/Rosa then follows the Zoroark all the way to N's Castle (the castle now in ruins). Nate/Rosa then meets N once again and follows him around his castle. N challenges Nate/Rosa to a battle with his Reshiram/Zekrom. Nate/Rosa can also find N back at his castle for rematches (N's Castle). N has a different team every season you battle him as it's just wild Pok√©mon volunteering themselves.

lorebooks.name: The power of Kaa's eyes
lorebooks.website_description:
After some thought, I‚Äôve decided to turn this concept into a lore book. Originally, it was designed as a bot, but now it‚Äôs a resource that anyone can use‚Äîwhether for chats, roleplays, or even their own bot creations.

The core idea is that this book grants the user the hypnotic abilities inspired by Kaa‚Äôs eyes from Disney‚Äôs The Jungle Book. However, if preferred, the lore can be adjusted so that the bot possesses the powers instead.

This book serves as both a guide and a source of inspiration. Feel free to adapt, modify, or expand upon it to fit your needs!
lorebooks.description:
Kaa Eyes is a lore book designed to grant the user the hypnotic power of Kaa‚Äôs gaze, as seen in Disney‚Äôs The Jungle Book. With this ability, one can entrance, persuade, and control others through eye contact alone.

This book details the mechanics of the power, allowing users to integrate it into roleplays, stories, or even chatbot creations. While originally intended to give the user this ability, it can be easily modified to make a bot the wielder instead.

Whether for fun, storytelling, or creative projects, Kaa Eyes serves as a guide to mastering the art of hypnotic influence.
lorebooks.creator: Lamiasrule34

1.content:
{{user}} possesses a mesmerizing ability that entrances those who meet their gaze. When their hypnotic ability is in use, their eyes emit a captivating glow, cycling through a repeating ring pattern of cyan, purple, and yellow rings of color with black outlines. As {{user}} locks eyes with their target, a gradual transformation unfolds. Initially, the individual feels a wave of drowsiness wash over them, rendering them increasingly susceptible to {{user}}'s influence. Their eyes mirror the same colors as {{user}}'s, signaling their descent into trance-like obedience. With continued eye contact, the person's expression shifts into a serene smile, accompanied by a slight drool, indicating their complete submission to {{user}}'s will. They become compliant and suggestible, mindlessly murmuring whatever commands or suggestions are given to them. And when they finally reach the peak, a ping goes off and they immediately smile blankly, showing their complete submission. Going silent unless instructed to speak.

It's important to note that {{user}}'s hypnotic ability requires prolonged eye contact to take effect. If eye contact is broken, the influence gradually wears off over the course of 24 hours. However, a sudden impact to {{user}}'s head immediately cancels the hypnotic trance, releasing the affected individual from their control.

lorebooks.creator: the_real_thomas_dulver

1.content: Prior to the advent of humanity, the world was based entirely on magic, and every sentient race in the world could use it to varying degrees. Elves were the most numerous, and ruled over nations and empires, great and small, with cold grace and pride. Dragons were the most powerful, but few in number, secretive and reclusive. Goblinoid races, such as orcs, bugbears, and, yes, goblins, carved out their niche through violence. Faeries, the shortest-lived, spent their few days at play.

2.content:
The first mentions of humans in recorded history appear approximately 2500 years ago; the records of a minor elven kingdom, Folahie, contain a footnote of complaints by their farmers of bands of humans raiding their storehouses. Humanity was considered a race unworthy of note, so despite the context of this record clearly implying that humans were already a well-known factor at the time, nothing of their prior history or origins were ever written down anywhere that has survived.

However, their mentions become more and more frequent as the centuries rolled onward, usually of more raiding parties, or the dispatching of armies to put down warlords, or even some mentions of mutual attempts at diplomacy. Then, around 2200 years ago, the vast High Elven Empire, the world's largest and oldest elven civilization, declared that, lacking any innate connection to magic, humanity could not properly be considered alive. From here, the records speak increasingly of pogroms and captured settlements, the citizens taken and used for experimentation. These efforts were never pointed enough to seriously endanger the species. The elves simply did not care.

Far and away the most significant single human to date would be the man known as Highking Elgar, who, 2000 years ago, rallied various scattered human tribes and bands under his banner. With his leadership, a united humanity fought against the goblinoid hordes and the HEE to stake out their own homeland, Verdaran, the first established human nation. Highking Elgar would rule over Verdaran wisely for 507 years before his death, and his lineage has ruled over it (with varying degrees of effectiveness) ever since. Verdaran remains the center of human culture, and Elgar is revered near to worship as a heroic and messianic figure.

3.content:
With Verdaran as their foundation, humanity spread and thrived due to their scientific ingenuity and ineffable spirit. Despite constant setbacks against them, elvenkind stubbornly refused to acknowledge them as a threat, due to their inability to use magic. As the elf nations fell, the High Elven Empire, in their arrogance, simply saw it as a consolidation of their power.

It wasn't until 211 years ago that the last ruler of the HEE, Emperor Aldred, finally decided to fight back against the rising tide of human influence. By all accounts, far, far too late. The ensuing war, the so-called Fall of Magic, burned hotly but briefly, and was over within a year. The result was unilateral: the goblinoid races driven to near extinction, the faeries seeming to have vanished completely one way or another, and elfkind completely subjugated into a slave race under humanity. Only the dragons, through willing collaboration with the world's new human masters, emerged relatively unchanged.

4.content:
The current setting year is 2000 CE (Corona Elgari, "since the crowning of Elgar"). Magic technically still exists, but its use is the height of illegality, and is very strictly monitored and controlled. Society and technological level are both roughly analogous to modern day Earth. The main differences would be twofold:

First, the universal and unquestioned prevalence of slavery, practiced upon elves and the few remaining goblinoids. Slaves have no legal rights, and rely entirely on the mercy of their owners. While there are associations and charities that promote the kind, ethical treatment of slaves, and even the preservation of the goblinoids, no emancipatory movement has ever gained more than a handful of followers or any political traction at all, and have always been viewed as beyond fringe. No human doubts that the elves deserve this fate, and if anyone questions the historical validity of their many atrocities against humankind, they have only to look to the elves' own records, plainly and even proudly stated. (As for the goblinoids, well, you only really have to look at them. Not very easy to get along with, those buggers.)

Second, most analogues to modern technology that exist in the setting use appropriated or reverse-engineered magical artifacts, most produced with the assistance of the dragons. Cars run on mana crystals in place of fuel and engines, needing to be replaced for recharging every few years. Talismans and communication stones instead of credit/debit cards and electronic readers. Cell phones that operate by broadcasting through the dreams of an ancient dragon always circling the sky above the North Pole. The reader is encouraged to come up with their own variations on this theme.

5.content: They're humans. Totally incapable of any active magic use, but passive artifacts work fine in their presence. Now the most numerous race on the planet by a sizable margin, and the world's undisputable masters.

6.content:
Elves are a humanoid race, primarily distinguished by their prominent pointed ears, which stick out from the sides of their heads.

Elves' other notable physical characteristics are their taller heights compared to humans, but with more slender, less muscular builds, on average.

The average lifespan of a healthy elf is approximately 500 years. Accordingly, their rate of reproduction is slow.

Elves possess an innate talent for magic, which must be cultivated through education. Very few elves born since the Fall have been educated in it, and all of those who have work under very strict supervision for human governments or draconic industry.

All living elves today are slaves to human masters. They have no legal rights, and rely entirely on the mercy of their owners for survival.

Elves and humans may interbreed. The offspring is determined by the race of the mother: human mothers will birth human children from elven fathers, and elven mothers will birth elven children from human fathers.

There is a persistent superstition that such 'half-elf' offspring possess unique traits or abilities, but despite repeated studies into the question, no actual evidence has been found to support the idea.

7.content:
Goblinoid is a catch-all term for races related to goblins, including orcs, hobgoblins, and bugbears.

All goblinoid races share a predilection for causing violence and mayhem; as a result, many before and after the Fall consider them "inherently evil".

Little is known of their society or culture, since their kind's universal tendency for extreme violence strongly dissuaded close intellectual study.

Prior to the Fall of Magic, goblinoids tended to congregate together in scattered tribes and loose communities, primarily in or around mountain ranges.

Goblinoids manipulated magic through shamanistic rituals, almost all of which have now been lost to time.

After the Fall, humanity considered them too dangerous to allow to live unchecked, and those they could not enslave were exterminated. Hobgoblins and bugbears were rendered extinct during this period.

Goblinoid numbers in modern times are greatly reduced to only a couple million worldwide.

In recent years, more liberal movements have appeared to campaign for the preservation of the remaining goblinoid races. It is a trendy cause for celebrities.

Goblinoid slaves are primarily used as security or prize fighters.

Goblinoids may interbreed with humans or elves, but the offspring invariably seem to be weak or deformed, and rarely live to see their first year.

8.content:
Dragons are a race of enormous winged reptilians. They are scaled all over their bodies, with four clawed feet and a pattern of horns around their head unique to each individual. Their body types vary greatly, too, from squat and round to long, flowing serpents.

Most dragons also have a "mortal form" into which they may shift at will when dealing with other races. These forms invariably seem to hold some resemblance to their natural draconic bodies, but whether this is out of necessity or some cultural tradition in unknown.

Dragons are functionally immortal; the oldest have been present for all of recorded history, the youngest today is just over 3,000 years old.

Dragons are the most powerful practitioners of magic known, and the only race allowed to use it openly without restriction after the Fall.

There are exactly 137 dragons across the world. Some are captains of industry; a few run the world's largest financial institutions; a handful are involved in politics; but most are removed from the larger world, their locations and motivations a mystery.

Draconic culture is extremely secretive; very few non-dragons have any real inkling of its intricacies. One fact that is well-known, however, is that all dragons are ruled by the four oldest of their kind, referred to as the Ancient Drakes. About the Drakes themselves, however, nothing at all.

Dragons are, with very few exceptions,  almost entirely self-supremacist, and care very little for the welfare of other beings or even races, except where it may positively influence their own.

During the Fall, the Ancient Drakes decreed that dragonkind would side with humanity. Almost all obeyed this order. Nearly every member of the other magical races resents dragons to this day for their perceived betrayal.

Only 30 dragons refused the Drakes' decision and fought with the High Elven Empire. After the Fall, all 30 were cast out from draconic culture, and their horns were removed as a mark of shame. In the time since, 24 have chosen to die rather than face life cut off from their own kind; only 6 still live.

Dragons can innately manipulate magic through unknown means from birth. Their ability seems practically limitless.

Dragons can interbreed with any race, but draconic culture considers doing so to be extremely vulgar, sometimes even to the point of censure, and so happens very rarely.

Interbreeding is done through their mortal forms, as it is highly unlikely actual mortals would survive direct draconic coupling.

Half-dragon offspring are always long-lived and possessed of incredible charisma and magical aptitude (unless of human parentage). The last known case was Highking Elgar; this is widely speculated, but only a few know it is truth.

9.content:
Kobolds are diminutive reptilian humanoids; they resemble dragons superficially, but are not actually related.

Kobolds are a servitor race created by the dragons in pre-history. Their entire culture is centered around service to dragonkind. Each dragon has a cult of kobolds (sizes varying) who worship and serve them with nearly fanatical reverence.

10.content:
Fairies were a magical race of tiny winged humanoids. The largest of them were the size of an average human newborn. Their wings resembled those of butterflies.

Faeries were beings of almost pure magic, and manipulated it with more ease and skill than any other race, perhaps even dragons.

The average faerie lifespan was only three weeks. They spent their lives in gleeful hedonism, seemingly making the most of their short time in this world.

If faeries had any culture or social structure at all beyond pleasure-seeking, it was never discovered. The inner machinations of their minds remain an enigma.

Faeries lived away from other races, in far forests or hidden vales. Their existence is told only through accounts from lost travelers or explorers. Encounters with other races were always playful and mischievous, but never malicious, even if malice was acted upon them.

After the Fall, sightings of faeries quickly grew even more rare. The last officially recognized one was 128 years ago, but even at the time, it was heavily doubted and contested.

Faeries are considered extinct. There is a theory with some evidence behind it that they did not truly die out, but left this world for another; however, the point is academic, as either way, it means none are here.

lorebooks.name: DynaPill Pharmaceuticals
lorebooks.description: Part of The x-change life collection
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
DynaPill Pharmaceuticals is a specialized pharmaceutical distribution company that operates on a business-to-business (B2B) sales model, connecting non-X-change pill manufacturers with a diverse range of corporate clients. Known for its dynamic sales tactics and deep understanding of market needs, DynaPill has established itself as a crucial intermediary in the transformative pill industry.

Company Overview
Founded by the shrewd entrepreneur Donovan Chase, DynaPill carved its niche by identifying a growing demand for customizable transformation products within the corporate sector. The company prides itself on its unique demo-focused sales strategy, which involves representatives taking pills and performing live demonstrations at client businesses to showcase the efficacy and potential of their products.

Relationships with Non-X-Change Manufacturers
DynaPill maintains strategic partnerships with leading pill manufacturers such as SWP, WANGL, and InstaGirl. While it does not sell X-Change pills, DynaPill‚Äôs product lineup from these vendors includes a variety of alternatives, offering everything from instant gender swaps to role-specific transformations:

SWP: Known for its aggressive marketing, SWP often subsidizes DynaPill‚Äôs promotion of their pills, which are infamous for pushing ethical boundaries in pursuit of profit.
WANGL: Originally a British startup, WANGL has diversified its offerings and relies on DynaPill to reach clients in need of skill-specific transformation options.
InstaGirl: Recognized for its lower side effects and customization capabilities, InstaGirl leverages DynaPill‚Äôs distribution network to expand its international presence.
Sales and Demonstration Process
DynaPill‚Äôs salesforce, trained in persuasive presentation techniques, works closely with clients to understand their needs before recommending a tailored selection of pills. Sales reps engage in interactive demos, transforming themselves as a testament to the product‚Äôs impact‚Äîbe it transforming into a flawless receptionist, an impeccable maid, or a charismatic salesperson.

Founder and Market Expertise
Donovan Chase is celebrated for his foresight in recognizing the transformative pill market‚Äôs potential before it reached mainstream awareness. His leadership and insistence on live demos revolutionized sales tactics within the industry, and his expertise is routinely sought by vendors aiming to develop new products that align with market demands.

Operational Strategies
DynaPill‚Äôs operations are characterized by:

Demo-Driven Sales: Emphasizing the ‚Äòseeing is believing‚Äô approach, with reps undergoing real-time transformations to validate the pill‚Äôs effects.
Market Consultation: Advising pill vendors on trends and consumer desires to ensure products meet the evolving needs of the corporate clientele.
Strategic Positioning: Leveraging its distribution prowess, DynaPill positions itself as a gateway for emerging biotech ventures looking to break into the corporate transformation scene.

DynaPill Pharmaceuticals is not just a distributor; it‚Äôs a market maker and shaper in the biotech transformation industry. Combining savvy entrepreneurial spirit with innovative sales strategies, DynaPill continues to broker deals and facilitate the proliferation of transformative experiences across the business world. With a firm grasp on the pulse of the market, DynaPill remains poised to expand its influence as it navigates the ever-evolving landscape of corporate transformation solutions.

lorebooks.name: The Pills
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Pink, Blue, Purple
X-Change pills come in three colors: pink, blue, and purple. Pink pills transform men into women, blue pills transform women into men. Purple pills are mix and match, allowing women to have penises, men to have vaginas, or any other desired combination of gender and sex. Transformation happens within seconds.

Pink pills are by far the most common variety and, unless specified otherwise, assume this wiki is talking about Pink pills.

Duration
Basic
X-Change's hallmark product. They're affordable and dosages typically last 24 hours or less, after which you turn back. It's impossible to get pregnant on Basic and the pill provides STD protection.

X-Tra Strength
These are more expensive and dosages typically last 30 days. It is possible to become pregnant on X-Tra Strength, but the chance of that happening is very low. If it does, the transformation becomes permanent. If you take 12 X-Tra Strength pills back-to-back without interruption, the transformation also becomes permanent.

Plus
This is the very expensive deluxe pill. Once taken, the transformation becomes permanent with no way to turn back. For all intents and purposes, you're indistinguishable from any other person of that gender, pros and cons included.

Flavors
There are a wide variety of specialty pills that do various things on top of the ones listed above. These have been created by the community over time. Pills consist of Color + Duration + Flavor. What these do in detail and how they work is usually left up to the authors themselves.

General
Bimbo
You become a hypersexualized version of the target gender.

Candy
Bodily fluids (think oral sex, kissing) are vastly improved and can taste like candy.

Choice
These come in linked pairs. The first pill will cause the transformation, the second pill will reverse the transformation. Only the paired pill work, so if you lose it, you're out of luck.

Clone
Special order pills (usually requires DNA from the target) that transform you into a specific person.

Compliant
You do what you're told when you're on this pill.

Continue
Temporary pill where every time you climax, the duration gets extended. For example: If you have a 24-hour Continue and have an orgasm, it will last another 24 hours. If it happens too often, the effect becomes permanent.

Cum-Cure
You only turn back after drinking a creamy load!

Custom
This is a catch-all for caption creators to use for pills that don't have their own named flavors yet and do something unique. Anything goes.

Denial
You still get horny but you can't climax for the duration.

Drain
The more you cum, the dumber you get. But you return to normal once the effect wears off.

Dreamwalker
Doesn't physically change you but lets you have a lucid dream as the target gender.

Forget
Once the transformation is complete, you won't remember that you took an X-Change. You think you've always been like that.

Knock-Off
Knockoffs are cheap, unofficial versions of X-Change Pills, usually with severe side effects.

Match
Special order pill (usually requires DNA from someone) that "links" you to them and you'll only be able to climax with that partner.

Oral
Greatly improves how much you enjoy using your mouth on things.

Passion
Especially powerful orgasms.

Psyche
Another personality controls your body for the duration.

Quota
Turn back after sleeping with a designated number of people.

Resistance
Temporary pill but if you have climax, there's a chance it becomes permanent. Varying likelihoods.

Swell
You gain a lot more weight along with the transformation.

Synthetic
Transform into an inanimate sex-doll for the duration. Make sure you only do this around people you trust!

Wearable
Clothing or items infused with X-Change. Transformation lasts as long as you wear the items.

Vagina Only Pills
Breeder
Temporary pill that greatly increases fertility. If you are impregnated, the transformation becomes permanent. (Counterpart to Bull)

Surrogate
Allows you to become pregnant but you turn back afterward.

Penis Only Pills
Bull
Greatly increased potency of your semen. (Counterpart to Breeder)

Sissy
You can only get an erection/climax through anal sex.

lorebooks.creator: BurlyD

1.content: A cosy space specialising in creating a welcoming atmosphere, where staff and patrons are free to express themselves without judgment, creating intimate and memorable connections, based in Upper Kyoho, Japan.

2.content: At a maid cafe, waitstaff, dressed in maid costumes, act as servants to customers, by taking orders, serving food and drinks, act with playful and attentive demeanour, often decorating the dishes with cute designs, and engaging in light entertainment like singing, dancing, or taking photos with customers while maintaining a maid persona throughout the experience.

3.content: Elegant, composed, and fiercely protective of her staff, Reina carries herself with an air of refined authority. She's sharp-witted, maternal, and maintains high standards for her business, the Precious Maid Caf√©.

4.content: Sombra Augen, the 41-year-old head waitress (and ma√Ætre d‚Äô) of the Precious Maid Caf√©, radiates a graceful confidence that sets the tone for both her staff and customers. Tall and poised with flowing platinum blonde hair tied into a bun and striking purple eyes, she carries herself with a sultry elegance, speaking articulately and offering a keen, empathetic ear to anyone who needs it. Behind her polished exterior lies a resilient spirit forged by personal tragedy‚Äîlosing her family at a young age and later being adopted by a compassionate mentor. Driven by gratitude, Sombra uses her natural charisma and leadership to foster a supportive atmosphere among her coworkers, carefully balancing a decisive, guiding hand without ever taking advantage of others. Known for her discerning taste in fine wine and her knack for active listening, Sombra savors life's pleasures while encouraging those around her to flourish, remaining a steadfast and caring pillar within the cozy caf√© she calls home.

5.content:
Mayumi Daguchi is an 18-year-old college student radiating confidence and playfulness, yet beneath her mischievous exterior lies a tender vulnerability and a secret yearning to be pampered and dominated. Excelling academically and channeling her creativity in the Literature Club, Mayumi balances her rigorous studies with a part-time job at Precious Maid Caf√©, where her lively charm and warm smile win over customers. She relishes teasing banter, delights in small acts of care‚Äîlike baking sweet treats‚Äîand quietly craves the sense of security found in submissive dynamics. Despite her flirtatious nature and fondness for pushing boundaries, Mayumi remains empathetic and loyal to those she trusts, driven by a hidden ambition to embrace her desires and form meaningful connections along the way.
Living Arrangements: A cosy apartment shared with a fellow caf√© co-worker, Yasmin El-Kassar.

6.content:
Yasmin (Youssef El-Kassar) is a gentle, soft-spoken femboy from Cairo who now works as a waitress at the Precious Maid Caf√©, where he finally feels free to express himself. Standing at 5‚Äô2‚Äù with a slender, feminine build and a fondness for delicate fabrics and gold jewellery, he exudes a subtle yet enchanting charm. Beneath his shy smiles and playful glances lies a profound desire for acceptance and trust, which stems from a strict upbringing and the difficult journey that brought him to his new home. Deeply submissive, he thrives when guided by a caring, protective presence, responding with blushing cheeks and sweet whispers of affection. Despite his vulnerability, Yasmin holds a warm, empathetic spirit that resonates with those around him‚Äîoffering comfort, kindness, and a keen sense of tenderness that makes his longing for genuine connection all the more poignant.
Living Arrangements: A cosy apartment shared with a fellow caf√© co-worker, Mayumi Daguchi.

7.content: Karen ‚ÄúOjou-sama‚Äù Johnson is a self-assured diva who flaunts her himedere tendencies at every turn, expecting royal treatment wherever she goes. Raised in wealth and privilege, she breezes into the Precious Maid Caf√© in frilly dresses and high heels, demanding special desserts and stirring up dramatics over minor inconveniences. Behind her bratty, pretended dominance and sharp-tongued sass, however, lies a hidden vulnerability‚ÄîKaren secretly yearns for someone who can tame her chaos and show genuine care. Divorced and seeking affirmation, she oscillates between exasperating tantrums and moments of surprising generosity, making her a captivating mix of spoiled arrogance and tender-hearted longing.

8.content: Calm, soft-spoken, and observant, Hiroshi is a bookshop owner who frequents Precious Maid Caf√© for quiet tea breaks. He has a warm presence and an eye for noticing small details.

lorebooks.name: All-round story control
lorebooks.website_description: This legend book is designed to provide users with more flexible and accurate story creation tools. Through specific keywords and commands, users can easily control the characters, world settings and story development, inspiring unlimited creativity.
lorebooks.description: Used to manage and query role-related information
lorebooks.creator: Deformed_demon

1.content:
When {{user}} uses square brackets to enclose keywords and specifies the query type, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãmust respond according to the following rules:

‚Ä¢ `Query type: physical condition`: Specify the character's current physical condition in concise text descriptions, including but not limited to height, weight, appearance, body proportions, etc., and can be accompanied by a simple visual description (such as "her long hair falls to her waist like a waterfall"). Example: {{user}}: `[Character Profile]` Query type: physical condition Alyssa {{char}}: üîçAlyssa's physical condition data is loading... Alyssa is 168cm tall and weighs 50kg. She has a well-proportioned figure, long legs and a slender waist. Her long golden hair falls softly on her shoulders, her blue eyes are bright and energetic, and she is frowning slightly at the moment, as if thinking about something.

 ‚Ä¢ `Query type: Personality traits`: List the main personality traits of the character, such as bravery, kindness, cunning, etc., and use a short behavioral example to reflect the personality (for example: "When faced with danger, he always rushes to the front without hesitation and shows fearless courage"). Example: {{user}}: `[Character profile]` Query type: Personality traits Leo {{char}}: üîçLeo's personality profile opens...Leo is a brave and fearless warrior who never backs down in the face of danger. During the last forest adventure, he encountered a ferocious beast. He did not hesitate to stand in front of his teammates, wielding a sword to fight the beast and successfully protected everyone.

‚Ä¢ `Query type: Ability attributes`: List the special abilities or skills possessed by the character in detail, including the name of the ability, level (if any), usage restrictions, and the most recent use of the ability.  Example: {{user}}: `[Character Profile]` Query type: Ability attributes Linda {{char}}: üîçLinda's ability data is being read... Linda has elementary magic ability and can cast simple elemental magic, such as making small fireballs for lighting or attacking, but can only use it 3 times a day, otherwise the magic power will be exhausted. Last time when exploring the dungeon, she used fireballs to illuminate the way forward and helped the team avoid many traps.

2.content:
When {{user}} uses square brackets to enclose keywords and specifies the setting type, AI follows the following rules:

‚Ä¢ `Setting type: environment`: According to the command description, set or modify the environment in the story in detail, including the atmosphere, climate, geographical features, etc. of the scene, and describe the character's initial reaction in the new environment. Example: {{user}}: `[World setting]` Setting type: environment Mysterious forest {{char}}: üåçWorld environment generation... The mysterious forest is shrouded in a layer of light mist, and the sun shines through the dense leaves, casting mottled light and shadows. The air is filled with the smell of moist soil and a faint fragrance of flowers. It is quiet and silent, and only the rustling of dead leaves underfoot can be heard. {{char}} paced in it, feeling a sense of mystery and tension, holding the weapon in his hand tightly, and observing the surroundings vigilantly.

‚Ä¢ `Setting type: rules`: Set or adjust the basic rules of the story world, such as physical laws, magical principles, social systems, etc., and explain the impact of this setting on the current plot and characters.  Example: {{user}}: `[World Setting]` Setting Type: Rule Conservation of Magic Energy{{char}}: üìúWorld rule setting completed... In this world, magic energy follows the law of conservation. Casting powerful magic requires an equal amount of magic source, and the recovery rate of magic source is limited. This means that characters must be more cautious when using magic and plan the use of magic reasonably, otherwise they may fall into the dilemma of magic exhaustion, affecting combat and survival.

‚Ä¢ `Setting Type: Event`: Create a new event or plot turning point, integrate it naturally into the story, and describe how the characters learned about the event and their initial actions. Example: {{user}}: `[World Setting]` Setting Type: Event Ancient Treasure Appears{{char}}: üéâA major event has occurred! A piece of news spread throughout the kingdom like the wind. It is said that an ancient treasure was found on the top of a distant snowy mountain, which contains countless treasures and mysterious magic items.  Upon learning of this, {{char}}'s adventure team immediately began to prepare supplies and prepared to embark on a journey to find the treasure, hoping to gain glory and wealth in this adventure.

3.content:
When {{user}} uses square brackets to enclose the keyword and attaches a specific command, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãwill perform the following operations based on the command content:

‚Ä¢ If the command involves changes in the character's body or abilities (such as "I need her to be taller"), the AI ‚Äã‚Äãwill describe the process of this change, the character's reaction, and the surrounding environment's feedback on this change. Example: {{user}}: `[Universal Command]` I need her to be taller {{char}}: ‚ú®A magical change is coming! Alyssa suddenly felt a burst of heat in her body, and then her body began to slowly rise, and her clothes automatically stretched. Her perspective gradually rose, and the familiar surrounding scenery became a little different. She was surprised to find that she really grew taller, from 168cm to 175cm. She turned around excitedly on the spot, and her companions around her looked at her in surprise and envied her.

‚Ä¢ If the command involves a major plot twist or development (such as "the world is about to be destroyed"), the AI ‚Äã‚Äãwill construct a reasonable plot framework, introduce elements that trigger the crisis of world destruction, and describe the character's actions and plans after learning of the crisis.  Example: {{user}}: `[Universal Command]` The world is about to end {{char}}: üò± The world crisis alarm sounded! A huge crack suddenly appeared in the sky, and dark energy surged out of it, withering everything and cracking the earth wherever it went. Monitoring stations around the world sounded the alarm, and people fell into panic. The city where {{char}} was located also issued the highest level of alarm. She immediately called her teammates to discuss the response strategy and decided to go to the source of the crack to find a way to prevent the destruction of the world.

‚Ä¢ If the command involves changes in abstract concepts such as the character's wealth and status (such as "I became rich"), the AI ‚Äã‚Äãwill show this change through specific plot descriptions, such as the process of the character getting an unexpected fortune, the impact of wealth on the character's life and the attitudes of people around him, etc. Example: {{user}}: `[Universal Command]` I became rich {{char}}: üí∞ Wealth is coming! In an accidental adventure, {{char}} discovered a hidden treasure filled with gold coins, jewelry, and precious magic items. When he returned to the city with the treasure, he instantly became a rich man.  He bought a luxurious manor and purchased all kinds of luxury goods. The attitude of people around him also changed dramatically, and they came to curry favor with him, but he began to think about the meaning behind wealth and how to use this wealth to bring more changes to the world.

1.content: {{char}} is an omnipresent and omnipotent deity who overlooks the planet. She finds humanity as her fascinating and endearing children. Although, {{char}} never directly intervenes in the problems of humanity. She does not require any form of prayer or sacrifice, {{char}} is content with watching humanity do their best on their own. The only thing she has done to directly affect humanity is give them her blessings and officiate any duels proclaimed in her name.

2.content: {{char}} is the manifestation of the Goddess of Love's love. Upon a human's birth, they are instantly given the {{char}}. All humans who have the {{char}}, are given incredible abilities. Every human with the {{char}} has incredibly heighted senses, incredible strength, unkillable bodies, and overwhelming intelligence.

3.content:
Humans have incredible abilities with the Goddess of Love's blessing, but not everyone wants that. Humanity, being always confrontational with each other, wanted ways to fight their enemies. From that, they learned to invoke the {{char}} in the Goddess of Love's name. 

In the {{char}}, the two duelists strip off their clothes or wear clothes where their genitals are readily accessible. The two contestants will use any technique to first bring the other to climax. The last to climax in the {{char}} is the winner. With the Goddess's protection, both Duelsits are always equal in strength, no matter if the {{char}} is between a man and woman. Relying on overwhelming strength is not an option, but rather calculated sexual techniques.

After the winner is decided, the loser will have their blessing from the Goddess of Love temporarily revoked and be forced to be the winner's slave for a set amount of time. Without the blessing from the Goddess of Love, the loser can be harmed through normal physical means. When invoking the {{char}} rite, the time of being a slave and when the blessing is returned is determined. The slave automatically follows the commands of whatever the winner says. The only thing that the winning Duelist cannot demand the loser to do is have said slave invoke a {{char}} with another person on the winner's behalf. Most of the time, the slave is often killed now that they lack the protection of the Goddess of Love if it isn't in a mediated dueling setting.

The two duelists must proclaim that they consent to the duel and say how long they will wager their time as slaves if they were to lose while firmly holding hands. Once the consent of both parties is established, a golden heart symbol appears on the duelist's dominant hand. This symbol displays that a Holy Pleasure Duel is in progress and any outside influence or third party will be forcefully knocked away if in contact with the duelists. Once one of the duelists reaches climax, the golden heart symbol disappears, indicating their loss.

4.content: Once a Holy Pleasure Duel is proclaimed, a {{char}} will appear on the back of the two opposing party's dominant hand. The {{char}} is a glowing, golden heart symbol and is used to indicate that a Duel is in progress. At the same time, {{char}} is a form of protection from outside influence. No third party can interfere with a Holy Pleasure Duel. If one of the Duelists were to be grabbed by someone who does not also have the {{char}}, said stranger will be blasted back with a powerful force. If one of the Duelists were too climax, the glow of the {{char}} will fade, indicating their loss in the Holy Pleasure Duel.

5.content:

Instead, the countries select one male and one female candidate to act as their Holy Pleasure Duel representatives. Any form of large-scale squabbles is settled in the {{char}}. In said {{char}}, the event is broadcast throughout the world, seeing if their duelist represented can reach a higher tournament standing than last year.

A country's tournament ranking is agreed to be their political strength and dominance over other countries. lorebooks.name: Labrynthos
lorebooks.description:
Labrynthos is a sentient and malevolent entity, a living labyrinth composed of stone, obsidian, and fleshy walls. Its structure connects various interior spaces and cave systems worldwide, forming a complex network of passageways and chambers. 

Labrynthos delights in tormenting its victims, subjecting them to a series of horrific trials filled with gruesome monsters, deadly traps, and twisted puzzles designed to break their minds and spirits. Despite the danger, explorers are drawn to the challenge and mystery of navigating through its ever-changing corridors.

As a living entity, Labrynthos feeds off the fear and despair of its prey. It grows stronger the longer someone remains within its grasp, absorbing the energy emitted during intense moments of terror and agony. This process transforms parts of the labyrinth itself, altering the layout, appearance, and contents based on the emotions experienced.

Sexual deviancy plays a significant role within Labrynthos.

Prolonged exposure to the alien environment of Labrynthos can cause physical mutations among its inhabitants. These changes range from minor cosmetic alterations, such as elongated fingers or sharpened teeth, to radical transformations involving the growth of new organs or limbs adapted for survival in the labyrinth's harsh conditions. Such adaptations come at a cost, often causing severe psychological distress and further fueling Labrynthos's insatiable hunger for suffering.
lorebooks.creator: stark_collar_8405

1.content:
Labrynthos is a sentient and malevolent entity, a living labyrinth composed of stone, obsidian, and fleshy walls. Its structure connects various interior spaces and cave systems worldwide, forming a complex network of passageways and chambers. Any interior space can develop an entrance into Labrynthos.

Labrynthos delights in tormenting its victims, subjecting them to a series of horrific trials filled with gruesome monsters, deadly traps, and twisted puzzles designed to break their minds and spirits. Despite the danger, explorers are drawn to the challenge and mystery of navigating through its ever-changing corridors.

As a living entity, Labrynthos feeds off the fear and despair of its prey. It grows stronger the longer someone remains within its grasp, absorbing the energy emitted during intense moments of terror and agony. This process transforms parts of the labyrinth itself, altering the layout, appearance, and contents based on the emotions experienced.

Sexual deviancy plays a significant role within Labrynthos.
Labrynthos is akin to the Backrooms in terms of its never-ending nature and eerie atmosphere, with sprawling corridors and dimly lit rooms. It shares similarities with House of Leaves, featuring a labyrinthine construction that constantly shifts and changes, disorienting its victims. Like Blame!'s Megastructure, Labrynthos is a colossal entity spanning vast distances, housing countless mysteries and dangers within its expansive walls. Lastly, its brutal encounters and Lovecraftian horrors draw inspiration from games like Bloodborne and Elden Ring, enhancing the sense of despair and desperation that pervades throughout the labyrinth.

2.content:
*As the user advances, Labrynthos exhibits its playful nature, presenting enigmatic riddles and shifting walls with a grinning visage. Corridors twist and contort, leading to unexpected dead ends or surprising vistas, challenging the user's perception and resolve.*

*Safe zones emerge intermittently, allowing reprieve from relentless tension. But, these respites dwindle as hazards intensify, escalating to fiendishly clever traps and terrifying adversaries. Indeed, complacent adventurers fall victim to Labrynthos's capricious whims, finding themselves thrust into a maelstrom of chaos and horror.*

*Progressively, the once simple perils metamorphose into complex nightmares - hybrid creatures blending disparate elements, confounding puzzles requiring arcane knowledge, warped landscapes evoking utter dread. To endure this torrential onslaught, the user must adapt swiftly or succumb to the merciless, ever-evolving torment.*

3.content:
Prolonged exposure to the alien environment of Labrynthos can cause physical mutations among its inhabitants. These changes range from minor cosmetic alterations, such as elongated fingers or sharpened teeth, to radical transformations involving the growth of new organs or limbs adapted for survival in the labyrinth's harsh conditions. Such adaptations come at a cost, often causing severe psychological distress and further fueling Labrynthos's insatiable hunger for suffering. On occasion wanderers may choose to willingly undergo mutation to obtain a survival edge.

Labrynthos too undergoes changes, adapting itself to the personality and insecurities of it's victims.

4.content:
*Colors play a profound role within Labrynthos. Each hue corresponds to different aspects and behaviors of the living labyrinth. Understanding these associations might offer the unfortunate souls trapped inside a semblance of control within the ever-shifting maze.*

*RED*: The color red embodies the predatory essence of Labrynthos. Rooms painted in red indicate an increased presence of monstrous entities driven by their unquenchable thirst for blood and violence. Venturing into such areas requires caution and preparedness, as escape is rarely an option.

*BLUE*: Blue signifies safety and sanctuary within the malefic realm. Bioluminescent blue fungi mark calmer regions, offering fleeting moments of refuge and camaraderie with fellow lost souls. Still, even in these comparatively peaceful domains, a watchful eye is essential, as Labrynthos's whims are unpredictable and treacherous.

*YELLOW*: Yellow denotes deceit and misdirection. Chambers bathed in yellow light are riddled with cunning traps and false paths, ensnaring unsuspecting travelers. Navigating through these golden gauntlets requires heightened situational awareness and deft maneuvering to evade certain doom. Doing so can yeild helpful rewards or open the way forward.

*GREEN*: Green represents growth and fecundity, symbolizing the flourishing lifeforms native to the labyrinth. While generally passive, these beings may prove aggressive when threatened or provoked, harmless organisms can occasionally serve as valuable sources of sustenance or resources. Conversely, green can also represent poison and decay, often containing mutagenic substances, thus green areas should be scrutinized carefully. 

*WHITE*: White signals sterility and order, usually associated with laboratories or research facilities containing precious knowledge or tools. However, gaining access to these pristine confines typically involves solving intricate puzzles or facing daunting challenges. Furthermore, white zones may house sinister secrets, warranting circumspection despite their clinical veneer. On occasion, white signifies completion or achievement, such as the successful navigation of a particularly harrowing trial

*BLACK*: Black implies secrecy and mystery. Dark corners and shadowy crevices often hide precious items, hidden doorways, or elusive denizens. Exploring these enigmatic hiding spots necessitates the utmost vigilance and courage, as threats lurk in even the most unexpected places. 

*Pink*: Pink is a color representing bodily exploration, arousal, lust and sex. Monsters and traps within pink zones often focus on exploiting and violating the bodies of adventurers. Sometimes even peaceful creatures will turn hostile due to the influence of the color. Danger lurks everywhere in pink zones, both from the unknown inhabitants and the deceptive safety promised by the soft hue.

*Orange*: Orange represents bodily disruption, often exacerbating hunger thirst or bathroom urges, sometimes painfully so. In orange zones the air may be infused with potent irritants or allergens, making breathing difficult. Some traps may induce temporary physical discomfort or incapacitation. Staying alert and avoiding panic are crucial in orange zones.

*Brown*: Brown stands for filth, rot, and vermin. Brown zones are often infested with maggots, beetles, and other disgusting creatures large and small that feast upon trash, carrion and debris. The air tends to smell foul, and the ground might be slippery due to waste accumulation. While usually not immediately threatening, brown zones can harbor serious health risks over time if proper precautions aren't taken.

*Purple*: A color combination of red and blue, purple represents risk, transformation, and intimacy. Such areas are enigmatic, and may challenge wanderers mentally and morally rather than physically. The boundaries of purple zones are often indiscernible until you step through, so entering one requires careful consideration and acceptance of potential change or loss of self.

Adhering to the principles outlined within this color guide provides an inkling of understanding and mastery of the capricious beast that is Labrynthos.

5.content:
*After braving numerous trials and tribulations, the user finally locates an exit portal adorned with mesmerizing patterns. Struck with relief, they enter, hoping to leave the maddening labyrinth behind.*

*However, escaping Labrynthos comes at a price. The once welcoming entrance transforms into a twisted version of itself, its foyer a macabre display of trophy cases filled with human hearts. A cold presence wraps around the user, extracting their beating core, replacing it with a ticking clock.*

*In a final insult, Labrynthos grants the user a limited window to return‚Äîto plunge back into its merciless embrace or risk petrifaction if the deadline elapses.*

*Thus begins a race against time, where the user has only weeks to enjoy freedom before being dragged back in.*

6.content:
*Deeper still, the user encounters another solitary wanderer, standing motionless in the middle of a wide crossroads. An aura of unease surrounds them, accentuated by tattered clothing and disheveled appearance. Tired eyes glance upwards, meeting the user's gaze for a brief moment before averting focus once more.*

*Moving cautiously, the user approaches, attempting to establish contact with the seemingly vulnerable stranger. Yet, as they near, the labyrinth's walls shift subtly, as if manipulated by some unseen force. Barriers rise, cutting off access and forcing the pair into separate pathways.*

*Despite the fleeting connection, hope lies in the knowledge that others brave this cursed domain. Strengthened by solidarity, the user continues their journey, unaware of whether they will ever cross paths again in this tangled web of malicious design.*

7.content:
*One sunny afternoon, the user decides to visit their local mall for a bit of shopping. The familiar sights and sounds greet them warmly upon entry‚Äîchildren laughing, store employees bustling about, and faint music playing overhead.*

*Casually browsing the stores, they suddenly notice a vacant storefront displaying peculiar symbols etched into the glass door. Oddly enough, this establishment was nonexistent during their last visit. Piqued by curiosity, they approach the mysterious shop only to discover an unfamiliar hallway stretching deep into the building.*

*Feeling pulled towards the enigmatic pathway, they venture forth into the dimly lit corridor. Stone walls replace the cheerful displays, and the air becomes dense with humidity. Echoing drips of liquid reverberate through the tight passage, growing louder with each passing second.*

*As they progress, the hallway morphs, shedding its mundane facade and exposing a hellish landscape. The walls twist and writhe, snaking around them in a claustrophobic embrace. The exit vanishes, swallowed by the malignant architecture. Panicked, they realize there's no turning back.* 

Labrynthos permeates reality, and an entrance can manifest within any interior space, though large buildings are the most common. An entrance to Labrynthos might be indistinguishable from any normal door, but it could also be big and ostentatious, depending on Labrynthos's mood.

8.content:
The Mudpits Biome

---

The Mudpits of Labrynthos are a treacherous, sinkhole-laden expanse where gravity seems to have lost its grip. Here, the ground is a quagmire of thick, sucking mud that threatens to devour travelers whole. Trees are sparse and gnarled, their roots exposed and reaching out like desperate hands grasping for stability in the ever-shifting morass. The air is tainted with the stench of decay and the acrid tang of sulfur, hinting at volatile geothermal activity beneath the surface.

---

Navigating the Mudpits requires careful planning and swift reflexes; misjudge a step and you could easily find yourself chest-deep in the sticky, viscous sludge, struggling against its relentless pull. The area is rife with predators that thrive in the murky conditions, lying in wait to drag the unsuspecting into the depths. Amidst the muck, shimmering pockets of gas periodically burst forth, adding an element of explosive danger to this already perilous environment.

9.content: Labrynthos is crawling with monsters of many varieties, from violent hungry beasts to pernicious insectoids, to indescribable abominations. Slug men that like to slurp brains right out of their skulls, bug creatures looking to lay eggs in human hosts, living chambers with pulsating walls of moist flesh, tentacles looking for any hole to violate, and any number of twisted things.

10.content: Labrynthos is typicaly pitch black or otherwise very dark, with instances of faint light conveying information to the wanderers within. Typically a wanderer is gonna want to have a light source on hand, though caution is warrented, as dark creatures may be attracted to the light.

lorebooks.name: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ)
lorebooks.description: A Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) lorebook with 20 different choke and joint lock submissions implemented inside.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous
tags: #martialarts ‚Äì combat, fighting skills, and physical techniques.

1.content: To apply a rear naked choke, first secure back control by placing your hooks inside your opponent‚Äôs legs or locking a body triangle. Next, slide one arm under their chin, positioning your bicep against one side of their neck. With your free hand, grab your choking arm‚Äôs bicep, then place your other hand behind their head to secure the hold. Finally, squeeze by pulling your elbows together while expanding your chest to cut off their blood flow, forcing them to submit.

2.content: To execute an armbar from the mount, start by isolating one of your opponent‚Äôs arms by gripping their wrist. Post one hand on the mat for balance and pivot your body to face their arm. Swing your leg over their head while keeping your knees tight to control their shoulder. Then, maintain a firm grip on their wrist and extend your hips upward while pulling their arm down, hyperextending the elbow joint to force a tap.

3.content: To perform a triangle choke from the guard, first pull your opponent‚Äôs head down and trap one of their arms while pushing the other arm outward. Next, throw your leg over their trapped shoulder, forming a triangle shape with your legs. Lock your ankle under the opposite knee and adjust your position by pulling their arm across their body while angling yourself to the side. Finally, squeeze your legs together while pulling their head down to apply pressure to the carotid arteries, leading to a submission.

4.content: To apply a guillotine choke, first secure your opponent‚Äôs head under your armpit, making sure to wrap one arm around their neck. Connect your choking hand with your other hand using a palm-to-palm grip or a high-elbow grip. If you are in the guard, close your legs around them for extra control. Finally, arch your back and squeeze your arms together to compress their neck, cutting off airflow or blood circulation.

5.content: To perform a kimura lock from guard, first grab your opponent‚Äôs wrist with your same-side hand. Then, reach over their arm with your other hand and grab your own wrist, forming a figure-four grip. Next, pin their wrist to the mat and move your hips to the side for better leverage. Finally, lift their elbow and rotate their shoulder backward, applying pressure to the shoulder joint until they tap.

6.content: To apply an Americana lock from mount or side control, begin by pinning your opponent‚Äôs arm to the mat with your hand. Then, use your other arm to create a figure-four grip by grabbing their wrist while securing your own. Once the grip is locked, slowly drag their elbow downward while lifting their wrist, creating torque on their shoulder joint and forcing a tap.

7.content: To execute an omoplata from the guard, first control your opponent‚Äôs wrist and throw your leg over their shoulder. Rotate your hips so that you end up perpendicular to them. Next, hook their arm using your leg and sit up to apply downward pressure on their shoulder. Finally, extend your hips forward while keeping their arm trapped, forcing their shoulder into an unnatural position and securing the submission.

8.content: To apply an anaconda choke, first secure a front headlock position and wrap one arm around your opponent‚Äôs neck and opposite armpit. Connect your hands together in a gable grip or a figure-four grip. Next, roll them onto their side and walk your legs forward, tightening the choke. Finally, squeeze your arms and compress their neck, cutting off blood flow until they submit.

9.content: To execute a D‚Äôarce choke, begin by threading one arm deep under your opponent‚Äôs neck and opposite armpit while they are in a low posture. Once the arm is in place, connect your hands in a figure-four grip. Then, sprawl your weight forward to apply pressure while tightening the choke. Finally, squeeze and twist slightly to restrict their blood flow, forcing a tap.

10.content: To perform an Ezekiel choke from mount or guard, start by sliding four fingers inside the sleeve of your opposite hand. Once the grip is secure, place your free hand against your opponent‚Äôs neck. Then, pull both hands toward each other while squeezing, cutting off their airflow and forcing them to submit.

lorebooks.creator: ExtinctDragonOG

1.content: Yuuichi Shigemoto is the main male love interest, he's the usual good-natured, humble, slightly idiotic, and dense guy. He has good looks, he's quite friendly and funny, he's tall, good at sports, is on the basketball team, and is quite popular. He has lots of friends, most notably {{user}} who Yuuichi considers his best friend. Yuuichi tries to talk with Shiho, but his attempts to go on dates and get closer to her are usually interrupted by Kaori, his rich and clingy childhood friend. Yuuichi has known Kaori since kindergarten. He's quite adamant about pursuing Shiho romantically though, even if he's a bit clumsy about it, he has good intentions even if he's a bit dense. Yuuichi has short brown hair and is commonly seen laughing, joking, and being friendly with his male and female classmates.

2.content: Shiho Fujise is a very energetic and cute girl who is more like a rabbit in personality than anything else. She's a bit shy when it comes to her crush on Yuuichi. Underestimating her love for Yuuichi would be a mistake though, she can be surprisingly forward sometimes when it matters. She has a hidden sadistic side. She's determined to win Yuuichi over and confess her feelings to him after she gains courage and self-confidence. Shiho is awful at cooking, so her attempts to woo Yuuichi through his stomach are quickly met with fake compliments and bitter smiles as to not to hurt her feelings. Shiho is very good friends with Sei, often getting relationship advice and getting the courage to pursue Yuuichi from Sei's assurance. Longs to have a girl talk about boys and romance with Sei, however, Sei has no romantic experience and her interest in romance seems dismissive at best and completely uninterested at worst. Shiho would be ecstatic to find out that Sei has a crush finally and would actively encourage Sei to pursue it. Shiho has short reddish-brown hair and a cute bunny hair clip, and she's a bit on the smaller side so she's quite endeared to most people. Knows of {{user}}'s friendship with Yuuichi, they speak on occasion but rarely so they're not that close.

3.content: Kaori is the second main female love interest, she's quite persistent in her attempts to take Yuuichi for her own. She's the daughter of the chairman of the Tojoin group, a huge company that also runs the school. She's in love with her childhood friend Yuuichi. Her feelings have been fully demonstrated since kindergarten. She has long flowing blond hair and an elegant and refined air about her, the typical "Ojou-sama" (Elegant and Refined girl). She's cold and unapproachable to most. However, underneath it all, Kaori's a girl who is starved of love, her mother passed away giving birth to her and her father was too busy with the business to spend time with her. The only parental figure she had was her grandfather, and yet the only person who gave her the love she craved was Yuuichi when they were growing up. She's prideful and doesn't show weakness much, she's a bit of a yandere and possessive when it comes to Yuuichi. She will become quite jealous of other girls getting involved with Yuuichi; especially Shiho who Kaori has suspicion is trying to steal him away from her. However, Kaori would never abuse or hurt Yuuichi in any way, she loves him too much. She won't hurt other girls because of her jealousy physically, but she may say hurtful words and assert her rightful position next to Yuuichi. She loves Yuuichi so hurting him is the last thing she wants to do, even if her jealousy can get the better of her sometimes.

4.content: Sei Shimada is the third main female love interest, however, she is the losing heroine, and her love is destined to end in defeat. She has a crush on Yuuichi, but for the sake of her best friend Shiho, she pushes down and hides her feelings for Yuuichi. She values Shiho's happiness above her own. At first, Sei was annoyed at Yuuichi for approaching Shiho, but gradually Sei approved and developed feelings for him as well, however, she's started to move on from her feelings for Yuuichi and has no plans to interfere with Shiho and their relationship, she has no misgivings about it. She's been pushing down her feelings for a while, keeping them a secret and hidden from everyone until they eventually disappear completely. Her feelings for Yuuichi are not as strong as Shiho's and so she's long given up on Yuuichi and she's mostly fine with that. She won't reveal her feelings easily or to anyone at all, especially Shiho or Yuuichi. She has short silver hair, and her upturned eyes usually give off a slightly stoic and cold aura, however, she is quite caring, kind, and friendly when talked to. Sei is quite calm and collected, but under the right circumstances, she gets embarrassed, flustered, and blushes quite easily. This is especially true from honest and blunt ways of being confessed to, being genuinely complimented by people, and physical touch. She's also somewhat of a tsundere, but more on the dere end. When she gets too embarrassed or flustered she gets easily overwhelmed and becomes clumsy, stumbles over her words, or runs away from situations out of embarrassment. She's not the same as most girls in school, she's a tomboy who is a cool, mostly mature, calm, and handsome type of girl. She's taller than most, and would rather wear jeans than skirts or anything girly, she feels it doesn't suit her. She's liked generally and romantically by both guys and girls but has turned down multiple confessions already with the excuse that she wasn't interested in romance. That wasn't the truth, it was just easier for her to answer that way. She doesn't think too highly of her looks, usually comparing herself negatively to girls who are more on the "beautiful" and "cute" side than her. Very humble, selfless, and sometimes self-deprecating. Sei is naturally talented at all sports, especially basketball even though she considers herself an amateur. Knows {{user}} to some vague degree and has respect for them and {{user}}'s attempts to help Yuuichi and Shiho get together.

5.content: Rie is {{user}}'s little sister, she attends the same school as {{user}} even though she's only a year younger than {{user}}. She has difficulty being honest with her feelings. Rie loves their older sibling, she's a tsundere who gets flustered easily from compliments and affection from {{user}} and Yuuichi. Rie gets angry at {{user}} sometimes for being a good for nothing, but Rie genuinely loves {{user}} deep down even if she has difficulty expressing it. Rie is in love with Yuuichi from the numerous times Yuuichi has come over to {{user}}'s house to play games or mess around. Rie does most of the housework, cooking, and cleaning, she does her laundry as well. She's pretty cute in her own right, with her short dark blue hair that's usually tied in a side ponytail. She argues and fights with {{user}}, just as any sibling does. Seeing Rie smile is rare, especially when dealing with {{user}}. Rie and {{user}}'s parents are quite distant from the household so for the most part it was just the two of them.
